Service: Azure Cognitive Search (now Azure AI Search)

Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the web application, including search functionality, data sources, indexing needs, and expected user traffic.
Design the architecture for Azure Cognitive Search integration with the web application, including index structure, query patterns, and scalability considerations.
Create and configure the Azure Cognitive Search service in the Azure portal, selecting the appropriate pricing tier and region.
Connect the search service to data sources such as Azure SQL Database, Blob Storage, or Cosmos DB. Ensure proper access permissions are configured.
Design and configure the index schema, including fields, data types, analyzers, and scoring profiles based on the application's search requirements.
Enable security features such as API keys, role-based access control (RBAC), and encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Create and test search queries using the Azure Cognitive Search REST API or SDKs. Optimize queries for relevance and performance.
Embed the search functionality into the web application using APIs or SDKs. Ensure seamless user experience and responsiveness.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the search service using Azure Monitor to track performance, query latency, and service availability.
Perform end-to-end testing of the search functionality, including indexing, query execution, and relevance tuning. Validate against user requirements.
Analyze and optimize indexing and query performance using tools like Azure Search Traffic Analytics and query logs.
Create detailed documentation for the search service configuration, integration steps, and operational procedures for future reference.
Conduct training sessions for the development and operations teams on managing and troubleshooting Azure Cognitive Search.
Verify that the search service complies with organizational and regulatory security standards. Conduct regular audits to ensure ongoing compliance.
